description.p: Returns number truncated to a specified number of decimal places.

prototypes.prototype: Truncate as N(Number as N, DecimalPlaces as N)

description.p: The number of decimal places. A value greater than or equal to zero.
Returns the number truncated to a specified number of decimal places.

discussion.p: The Truncate function truncates a number to the specified number of decimal places. See also [NativeRound] and [Round].

example.caption: Truncate() function executed on the Northwind Access database

page.example: SELECT FIRST 1 Truncate(5.994,1) AS EXPR1 FROM Products = 5.9
